content.prompt: Which of the following is accurate regarding the Supreme Court’s interpretation of a right to privacy?

choices.label: The court has never acknowledged a right to privacy.
The court’s interpretations about a right to privacy have been consistently applied.
The court’s interpretation of a right to privacy has been the subject of controversy.
The ideological composition of the Supreme Court has not had an impact on its interpretation of a right to privacy.

topic.text: 3.9: Amendments: Due Process and the Right to Privacy

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
